attributes.action: Hold a referendum on Proportional Representation for parliamentary elections
attributes.background: Under our present electoral system the distribution of seats among the political parties bears no close relation to the total votes cast for those parties. In 2017, the average number of votes cast nationally for each party varied between just under 28,000 and over 525,000 votes per seat won.
attributes.additional_details:
This is unfair and unsustainable: since 2005 two general elections have produced no overall majority, and two have produced majorities which each resulted from just over one third of the votes cast.
20 years ago the Jenkins Commission recommended a proportional system to replace First Past the Post. A 2011 referendum offered instead the AV system which Jenkins had rejected as it is not proportional.
We therefore call upon Parliament to hold a referendum on the Jenkins Commission recommendation.

attributes.action: Keep motorcycle users safe by allowing use of bus lanes
attributes.background:
There are huge amounts of accidents where bikers are filtering and are knocked off due to other traffic. Whilst this is legal according to the highway code, the results usually end up 50/50 to both parties.

Allowing motorbikes to use bus lanes will reduce congestion and risk to everyone.
attributes.additional_details:
Filtering is a careful and slow moving ability but people sometimes don’t see the motorcyclist and ultimately could result in damage to both vehicles and a high risk of serious if not fatal injuries for the motorcyclist.
I’m asking for riders to be able to use the bus lanes to stay safe during heavy traffic and to be able to be seen more easily.
A few bus lanes already allow them but if taxis and cyclists can use them to get to the destination quicker, could we not use them to stay safer? Thanks

attributes.action: Require schools to teach our children about the British constitution
attributes.background: The Magna Carta and The bill of rights are still active today and cannot be written out these laws were put in place to protect the people of this country so it’s vital that they are taught from a young age

attributes.action: Home Office to confirm right to work on applications by way of acknowledgement
attributes.background: Those who work within the legal profession are aware that section 3C Immigration Act 1971 allow applicants who submit in time applications the right to reside and work in the UK whilst their applications are pending. Employers are  requesting for written confirmation by way of acknowledgement.
attributes.additional_details:
Family Members of EEA Nationals are issued such letters by way of Certificate of Application. Home Office should simplify the process by issuing Certificate of Application for immigration applications to help laymen, employers and employees.

The two tier system is causing confusing and individuals are being suspended from work unjustifiably and this can be resolved by the Home Office adopting the Certificate of Application style for all British linked immigration applications.

attributes.action: Halt the rollout of Universal Credit
attributes.background:
Universal Credit is having a massive impact on families in our country.
Cuts to the funding have forced many people into poverty and relying on food banks.
We believe the Government should halt the rollout of Universal Credit until the funding is fully restored.
Halt the rollout now!

attributes.action: Repeal the hunting act
attributes.background: Although foxes are beautiful to look at we have to remember that for many they are vermin and can carry diseases. Plus the costs they cause to landowners with the slaughter of lambs etc. Foxes will kill chickens, ducks etc beyond what they need at the time. It is something that needs to be managed.
attributes.additional_details: Around 400 members of the Royal College of Vets in London state that fox hunting is the most effective and humane way of managing foxes in the countryside compared to trapping, laying poison or shooting which prolongs the death of a fox

attributes.action: Raise awareness of endometriosis among young women and doctors
attributes.background: On average it takes 7.5 years for a woman to be diagnosed with endometriosis, this is often due to being told “it’s just bad menstrual cramps” or can be totally miss diagnosed. This is due to the education about the chronic illness.
attributes.additional_details: Statistic found from -https://www.endometriosis-uk.org/endometriosis-facts-and-figures

attributes.action: Grant tourist Visa-free access for UK to citizens of the Republic of Macedonia
attributes.background: Since January 2010 the citizens of the Republic of Macedonia were granted a Visa-free access to the Schengen area countries. We think that the United Kingdom needs to fallow the example set from the EU countries and the allow the Macedonian citizens a visa-free entry for tourism purposes in the UK.

attributes.action: Ban balloon and sky lanterns release to celebrate or commemorate someone.
attributes.background:
The impact on environment and danger to wildlife in undeniable. 
The response to the similar petition, given by the Department of Environment, Food and Rural Affairs on 22 May 2018 is unacceptable.
attributes.additional_details:
There are other, creative and meaningful ways we can celebrate and remember our loved ones.
Introducing the ban will send a clear message and save lives on our already tragically polluted planet. We're ought to protect them, for everyone's sake.
http://www.onegreenplanet.org/animalsandnature/balloon-releases-are-killing-animals/

http://encenter.org/visit-us/programs/birthday-parties/balloons/

attributes.action: Ban the use of single use plastic bags
attributes.background: By the year 2050 there will be more plastic in the sea than fish and it is estimated that In 2016, a global population of more than 7 billion people produced over 320 million tonnes of plastic waste compared with 1.5 million tonnes in 1950 and by 2034, this figure is estimated to be double.
attributes.additional_details: The average plastic bag you pick up at the grocery store, or carry your takeout in, has a lifespan of about 12 minutes. When discarded, they clog sewage and storm drains, entangle and kill an estimated 100,000 marine mammals every year, and degenerate into toxic microplastics that fester in our oceans and landfills for up to 1,000 years.

attributes.action: Fund ocrelizumab on NHS for those who suffer with early primary progressive MS
attributes.background: My mam has been diagnosed with progressive MS. We need ocrelizumab to be funded for patients like her as soon as possible.

attributes.action: Maintain current seismic thresholds for fracking activities.
attributes.background: Fracking activity in the UK currently has to work within strict thresholds for seismic activity that may be generated by fracking operations. A relaxation could lead to more frequent seismic activity up to a level where damage to property or injury to the public is more likely to occur.

attributes.action: 2 years minimum sentence for those convicted of assault on prison staff.
attributes.background: Over the years consecutive governments have failed to put in place a real deterrent to those prisoners who would assault prison staff. In all areas of the UK staff assaults are increasing. A minimum sentence would help to reduce these assaults
attributes.additional_details: I have been an operational prison officer for more than 20 years.

attributes.action: The UK should withdraw from the UN Global Compact for Migration
attributes.background: The UN's Intergovernmental Conference was held in Marrakech, Morocco on 10 and 11 December 2018. Some 125000 signed a parliamentary petition opposing it. Despite that the government signed it. We should withdraw from this Compact immediately
attributes.additional_details: The government should have postponed signing it until there was a parliamentary debate.

attributes.action: Do not lower UK food standards just to ease trade deals post Brexit
attributes.background: We the public request that UK food standards are not lowered to ease any trade deals post Brexit. Countries such as the USA, where their meat and assorted food stuffs are banned in many countries across the world due to their industry standards, are not welcome here.
attributes.additional_details: American livestock, chickens and fish are pumped full of synthetic hormones, such as recombinant bovine growth hormone, zeranol, trenbolone acetate and melengestrol. They contain copper and other toxins such as arsenic, are fed Ractopamine or a similar drug Zilmax. These are all linked to increased cancers in humans, including breast, prostate, lung and kidney cancer, increased stokes, and coronary heart disease. We must not allow American meat products into the UK market after Brexit.

attributes.action: Ban the incubating and hatching of chicks in school classrooms
attributes.background: Unhatched chicks are taken from their their mothers, and brought into school classrooms where they are denied everything that is natural to them. Chicks born in this manner often become sick and deformed. Many projects like this result in the chicks being euthanised when it is over.
attributes.additional_details:
This practice is cruel and vastly outdated in many ways. 
There is nothing educational about animals, the environment or life cycles that can be found from practicing such 'projects' or 'experiments'. 

Chickens have complex social bonds and 'pecking orders'. These types of 'projects' deny them a chance to develop their natural bonds and deprive them of natural beginnings, hence negating the natural observation of animals and respect for their lives.

attributes.action: Stop dumping of nuclear waste in the ground/off shore off Cymru
attributes.background: The Welsh Office/UK gov has failed in its duty to first consult MPs, AMs and more importantly the people of Cymru. Instead they have been 'consulting' behind closed doors. Transparency is needed not intrigue and a deadly legacy left for others.
attributes.additional_details: Cymru did not want nuclear nor does it want the waste from nuclear. An alternative answer must be found. In the meantime nuclear power stations should be closed and mothballed until science has caught up in its safe usage.

attributes.action: Make audio recording mandatory for all PIP assessments.
attributes.background: Thousands of people are having to appeal the decision made for their PIP entitlements. To help prevent any misunderstandings between patients and assessors, it should be mandatory for DWP (or ATOS) to audio record every assessment.
attributes.additional_details: Currently you have to contact Atos 3 days in advance to ask permission to use audio recording equipment in your PIP assessment. You have to pay for this equipment yourself and give the assessor an exact copy at the end of the assessment. This means you have to pay out for TWO dictaphones. You also have to sign an agreement, on the day, prior to any recording.

attributes.action: Screen expectant mothers for chicken pox immunity
attributes.background: The Varicella Blood Test can be carried out to see if you are immune. A small amount of blood is sent to a lab to check for Varicella Zoster Virus Antibodies. With this test you can be given the correct care quick enough to hopefully prevent any harm to your unborn child.
attributes.additional_details: I was exposed to chickenpox at 12 weeks & requested advice from my Drs on 3 occasions. I was told I had nothing to worry about because I had the virus as a child. The NHS website also states this. I ended up with chickenpox so severe that I was admitted to hospital for a week. The blood test would have shown that I wasn't immune & appropriate action could have been taken. Unfortunately, I lost my son at a day old due to complications believe to be caused by the chickenpox virus.

attributes.action: Put Defibrillator awareness on a TV advert.
attributes.background:
It would be great to spread the awareness of how a Defibrillator is used and how it works. A lot of people are not aware that anyone can use a Defibrillator and that they don’t need to be first aid trained to use one. 
What a better way in telling the nation how AED’s work than showing them on TV.
attributes.additional_details:
As a first aid trainer, I understand people don’t understand what a defibrillator is and how it works. 
In the past, there has been an advert created for CPR with Vinnie Jones, with staying alive song.  This was a huge hit to get awareness of getting people how it important It is to do something and how to perform cpr correctly. 
Running first aid courses, 80% of learners have no idea how an AED works.

attributes.action: Fund gastric stimulation and research into gastroparesis
attributes.background: NHS England don't fund the quality of life operation so many patients need. There is no cure minimal research and funding into a rare chronic illness to give the quality of life every person deserves Many patients with this condition have to crowdfund the £17000 operation with only 2 UK specialists
attributes.additional_details: The procedure is carried out with the patient under a general anaesthetic. A stimulating device (similar to heart pacemaker) is put into a small pocket made under the skin of the abdomen. When the stimulating device is turned on, it sends electrical impulses to the stomach muscles that help them to work more normally. The amount of stimulation can be adjusted to suit the patient. Patients may need to go back to hospital after the procedure to adjust the device. https://www.nice.org.uk/Guidance/IPG489.

attributes.action: Lower the voting age to 16!
attributes.background: The government are deciding what happens with the next generation’s future, yet they don’t get a say in it. Young people should get the vote, because they will have to raise their children in the environment that the government make.

attributes.action: Change the laws for fireworks only to use silent fireworks.
attributes.background: Every year when firework season is upon us it’s fun for many a nightmare for our pets and wildlife .listening to others it’s a very real problem ,and it seems the most benefit is too manufacturers making all kinds of tablets, plug ins, sprays thunder shirts etc to try and combat the problem.
attributes.additional_details: A town in Italy decided enough was enough and that pets and wildlife were being affected by these dinamite fireworks. That go off like bombs. And have now changed to silent fireworks, they still enjoy the display which could be musical but saves the stress from the incredible noises. (Collecchio in Italy ).

attributes.action: Allow students' placements to count towards 30 hours funded childcare criteria
attributes.background:
Students studying a degree with an integrated placement are required to have more contact hours than those without therefore for parents, childcare can be difficult to fund.
University limitations of number of hours students can work mean additional income to fund childcare is difficult to obtain.
attributes.additional_details:
It is grossly unfair that placement hours are not considered when deciding who should qualify for the additional funding.

This petition calls for the government to have a review of the guidelines regarding the eligibility of the additional 15 hours funded childcare for three and four year olds, and to introduce new criteria that allows students with integrated placements within their degree to have their placement hours taken into account when applying for additional funded childcare.

attributes.action: The UK Needs More Lifesavers, fund CPR training in schools
attributes.background: As a Sudden Cardiac Arrest Survivor I know only too well the importance of bystander CPR. There are 60,000 out of hospital cardiac arrests each year, yet 75% of the population are NOT trained to do basic CPR. Evidence suggests immediate resuscitation will triple chances of survival.
attributes.additional_details:
#CPR in schools is a national prize-winning programme for trainee healthcare professionals from all disciplines to teach Basic Life Support Skills to children in schools across the country:
 
*Teaching children life-saving skills. 
*Inspiring children to have careers in the NHS.
 
This petition calls on the government to fund a national programme of training in CPR in schools.

attributes.action: Make PrEP available through the NHS across the whole of the country.
attributes.background: Pre-exposure Prophylaxis (PrEP) is a life saving drug which prevents the contraction of HIV/AIDS. In the UK, only Scotland provides PrEP through the NHS.
attributes.additional_details:
We demand the government make PrEP available through the NHS across the country. It is a low-cost intervention - there is no excuse.

Use of PrEP reduces new HIV infections among men who have sex with men, heterosexuals, people who inject drugs. We were inspired by our MP publicly revealing his status in parliament on World Aids Day last week. 
 
PrEP is not only beneficial from a public health perspective, but also financially. It should be universally accessible across the UK.

attributes.action: Add a duty requiring MPs to act in the interest of their constituency's wildlife
attributes.background: Under the "Code of Conduct" MPs have a general duty to act in the interests of the nation as a whole; and a special duty to their constituents. An additional special duty should be added requiring all MPs to act in the interests of their constituency's wildlife e.g. conserving biodiversity.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK is among the most nature-depleted countries in the world. 40% of all Britain's species are in moderate or steep decline. 1 in 5 British mammals are at risk of extinction.
 
There is widespread evidence that a better relationship with nature can improve our health and wellbeing as well as make our country more enjoyable to experience, beautiful and resilient.
 
It's time our country, with leadership from our MPs, forged a more caring relationship with their "wild constituents".

attributes.action: Publish all official documents surrounding Brexit negotiations
attributes.background: The British public found out in 2001, via secret documents released under the 30 year rule, they'd had information withheld prior to EEC accession. Make the UK Prime Minister publish all communications & dealings surrounding the EU & Brexit negotiations so that the British public can know the truth.
attributes.additional_details:
Secret documents that show the British public had vital information withheld from them include the following:

Document Reference: FCO 30/1048
(Last available here - http://discovery.nationalarchives.gov.uk/details/r/C11018818)

Document Reference: FCO 30/789 
Foreign Office - 9th November 1970
(Last available here - http://webarchive.nationalarchives.gov.uk/+/http://www.nationalarchives.gov.uk/documents/nyo_2001.pdf)
Document Reference: CAB 164/771 
Giscard and Rippon - 24th November 1970

attributes.action: Make advertising for paid lifts illegal unless it's through a licensed operator.
attributes.background: Illegal paid 'lifts' are being offered on social media. Groups have been set up on FB offering 'lifts that are cheaper than a taxi'. Legitimate private/public hire drivers are DBS checked. Their cars are tested to make sure they are roadworthy. These are in place to protect members of the public.
attributes.additional_details: Legally, if being paid to transport someone via a motor vehicle, hire and reward insurance must be in place. This is only available to licensed drivers who hold a badge issued by their local authority. Unlicensed 'paid lifts' aren't insured. This puts the public at risk & the general response from the police &/or LA is that there is nothing they can do. It is only a matter of time before someone is seriously hurt in an accident or attacked. Those advertising unlicensed lifts should be prosecuted

attributes.action: Allow victims of Child Sexual Abuse the location of their Offenders release
attributes.background: The man who abused me has been released from prison. I am still not allowed to know where he is located. A high-profile sex offender who destroyed my life. I should have the right to know where he is to minimise the risk to myself and my family.
attributes.additional_details:
Clare’s Law: The Domestic Violence Scheme, that offers members of the public the right to ask the police if their partner may pose a risk to them. 
Sarah’s Law: The Sex Offender Disclosure Scheme, that allows anyone to formally ask the police if someone with access to a child has a record for child sexual offences. 

He is on licence conditions to not come near my home, so he was released information of my vicinity. Victims should be allowed this information about their offender, especially when the offender is allowed to know where their victim lives.

attributes.action: Raise the profile of menopause in the public domain
attributes.background: Menopause affects half the population at some point in their lives, but menopause is often not acknowledged, taken seriously or knowledgably by Health Care Professionals. As many women are now employed and work for longer, greater awareness is needed to be more healthy and productive for longer.
attributes.additional_details: Provide more awareness and clarity on menopause through leaflets at Health Care Providers, emphasising that it's not just hot flushes that signal menopause. Target women in their 40s, 50s and 60s to cover all stages of menopause. Many women on contraceptives such as the mini-pill or the coil do not menstruate so need guidance. Integrate the information into the NHS website so that if you search for subjects such as memory loss, tiredness, anxiety etc. it states menopause as a possible cause.

attributes.action: Review current policy allowing councils to turn off street lights at night.
attributes.background:
As police numbers fall and crime rates rise it is causing a feeling of insecurity amongst local communities as many councils turn off ALL ‘non essential’ street lights. 
We feel that street lights are needed for the well being of our community

attributes.action: Scrap smart motorways and bring back the safety of the hard shoulder.
attributes.background: When your vehicle has issues on a motorway, you look for the safety of the hard shoulder. Smart motorways have removed this and are not smart enough to recognise lane 1 blockages quick enough. As a consequence, lives are put at imminent risk.
attributes.additional_details:
Since the implementation of motorways, there has always been a hard shoulder which served several purposes. It is a safe zone for a vehicle to use if there's a mechanical problem, if there is a sudden emergency and more so, it was a clear lane for emergency services to use. 

Since the implementation of smart motorways, this lane has become a live lane and if the unforseen happens, you are stranded in what is now a death trap and also delaying emergency vehicles attending an incident.

attributes.action:
Justice for cats
Make it law to report hitting a cat
attributes.background: I lost my cat a few years ago to a taxi car speeding down my road my road s a no through road)  he new he had hit her but carried on to collect his ride. On the way back acknowledging he knew he hit her and left the seen. If she was a dog she would have had rights but cats don’t. Justice for cats.
attributes.additional_details: I love my cats as much as I loved my dog.

attributes.action: Continue to fund free TV licences for the over 75 in the future.
attributes.background: Removing them will only penalize the poorest old age pensioners, many who rely on their television for company and their main source of entertainment.

attributes.action: Give Grandparents rights to see Grandchildren
attributes.background:
We want to give grandparents the right to see their grandchildren when couples spilt up, unless they are a risk. There are too many kids who are
deprived of seeing their grandparents because of couples splitting
up.
attributes.additional_details: Without this right, good grandparents get stopped from seeing there grandkids every every day in Britain. The right would be to allow grandparents and grandchildren acesss to see each other

attributes.action: Increase funding for Bedfordshire Police to combat the rise in serious crime.
attributes.background: Bedfordshire is classified as a rural Police force, yet it has every major crime that larger cities such as Manchester, Birmingham and London have. Luton alone has an International Airport, Gun, Gang and knife crime, terrorism and hate crime, as well as a massive problem with anti social behaviour.
attributes.additional_details:
Our Officers in Luton are inundated with exceptional volumes of calls, to a point where they are unable to attend crimes in progress due to a lack of resources.
This has happened numerous times In the past 6 months, to a point where local residents do not report crime because they know Police will not attend.
Our own local Policing Team should have up to 10 officers, but due to cutbacks and lack of funding we are now down to 3, which is a reduction of 70%, and this is echoed across the county

attributes.action: Ban single-use cups in cafes when customers are 'eating in'.
attributes.background: This is unnecessary consumption of paper and plastic resources. Very few single-use cups can be, or get recycled. For customers who are drinking their drinks on the premises, cafes should be required to use mugs / ceramic cups and wash them up.

attributes.action: Lift the UK Travel Advisory on Direct Flights to Sharm-El-Sheikh
attributes.background: The UK is one of the only European nations refusing to lift its advisory against 'all but essential air travel to and from Sharm-El-Sheikh'. DIVE Magazine is calling for the restrictions placed on one of the UK's best-loved destinations, especially by divers, to be immediately rescinded.
attributes.additional_details: Prior to the Russian airline disaster of 2015, UK tourists constituted the second-highest percentage of visitors to Sharm. Loss of the UK market had a devastating impact on Egyptian workers, local businesses, and UK tour operators - and continues to do so. Over £20million has been invested in updated airport security. The resort itself is deemed to be safe. Almost every other European nation is flying. It's been more than 3 years. It's time to lift the 'ban'

attributes.action: The UK Government to regularly measure household food insecurity across the UK.
attributes.background: It's estimated that millions of people in the UK are food insecure. Food insecurity can vary from worrying about not being able to access enough food to going whole days without eating. Without regular monitoring, we cannot begin to understand the true scale of the problem nor its impact on health.
attributes.additional_details: Emma Lewell-Buck's Food Insecurity Bill would require the government to routinely monitor and report on food insecurity. Trussell Trust food bank statistics demonstrate growing food poverty but there are many more independent food banks and other food aid providers operating today. And we know that help is accessed as a last resort -  most food insecurity is hidden from view. Food insecurity is measured in Canada which means its health implications and long-term costs are understood.

attributes.action: Fund more medical research into Neuroblastoma
attributes.background:
Neuroblastoma is a Cancer In Children. Mostly under fives. 
It’s the most common form of Cancer In Babies.15% deaths in children.
One in 7000 children are affected.
The treatment is very aggressive and more support for the families diagnosed with Neuroblastoma is needed now.

attributes.action: To implement and legalise stringent plastic recycling plans in UK hospitals
attributes.background: Around 5 million tonnes of plastic waste is generated annually in the UK. There are no sustainable, formal recycling plans currently in place for healthcare-generated plastic waste. Whilst a proportion of this must be incinerated due to contamination, a huge amount is conventionally recyclable.
attributes.additional_details: We want it to be a legal requirement that every UK hospital has a streamlined non-contaminated plastics waste recycling scheme. We call on the government to introduce new and sustainable methods of recycling this plastic, and to implore manufacturers supplying single-use plastic disposable items to develop more resource-efficient methods of sterilising and packaging products for use in the healthcare industry. www.wrap.org.uk www.who.int www.plasticpollutioncoalition.org www.recycle-health.org

attributes.action: Put Synchronised swimming on the GCSE PE Syllabus as a sport option.
attributes.background: The current GCSE PE syllabus does not allow synchronised swimming as a sport option either individually or as a team. It is discriminatory and grossly unfair on the thousands of swimmers who spend 15 hours or more each week training and can not use their chosen sport for a GCSE option.

attributes.action: Offer a biopsy to all women referred to a breast cancer clinic
attributes.background: I want every women referred to a breast clinic with a lump in there breast to have a biopsy rather than an ultrasound so they can be told 100% if the lump is cancerous.
attributes.additional_details: My wife went to a breast clinic with a lump in her breast where the consultant only did a ultrasound and not a biopsy. She was told it definitely wasn't cancer. They never did anymore investigating in to her lump as they didn't think it was cancer. Three years later the same lump got a biopsy and it was cancer. My wife lost her life because she didn’t get a biopsy to tell us 100% if it was cancer.

attributes.action: Allow tax payers to opt out of funding war and fund conflict prevention instead
attributes.background: All UK taxpayers, including corporation tax payers, should have the opportunity to express their conscientious objection to their taxes being used on military and weapons. Instead the amount of their tax which would have been spent on military and weapons should fund conflict prevention programmes.

attributes.action: Exempt ALL NHS Healthcare Professionals from the Minimum Earnings Threshold
attributes.background: Non-EU citizens seeking Indefinite Leave to Remain the UK are required to earn £35,000 a year. In an era of austerity, when our NHS is stretched and there are vacancies across all healthcare professional roles, it is both immoral and unethical that we send highly committed and skilled workers away.
attributes.additional_details:
Allied Health Professionals are the 3rd largest workforce in the NHS and without them most patients would not be able to return to their homes and be as independent as they are
https://www.england.nhs.uk/ahp/about/

Of the 1.2 million staff in the NHS almost 10% are from Non-EU countries
https://researchbriefings.parliament.uk/ResearchBriefing/Summary/CBP-7783

At present there are 4000 Physio vacancies in the NHS
https://www.csp.org.uk/news/2018-06-14-csp-seeks-answers-visa-exemptions

attributes.action: Government to adopt a single comprehensive measure of poverty as standard
attributes.background:
Government does not have an official standard measure of poverty and currently uses measures based simply on mean income.
This is not an accurate measure of poverty. We demand parliament legislate to adopt a comprehensive measurement similar to or the same as Social Metrics Commission measure.
attributes.additional_details:
The current government measure of poverty uses 4 different measures based simply on mean income.

Considering stagnated wages, rising costs, homelessness rising, impact on disabled people, rising childcare costs, overcrowded housing etc. These issues should always be taken into account when measuring poverty, not just a mean income.

We, therefore, think this parliament should legislate adopt the same as or similar to the Social Metrics Commission new measurement of poverty as a set standard.  (see below)

http://socialmetricscommission.org.uk/MEASURING-POVERTY-SUMMARY-REPORT.pdf

attributes.action: Provide separate labour wards for women giving birth to stillborn babies.
attributes.background: I gave birth to my dead baby boy on a maternity ward 17 years ago surrounded by crying babies. It was soul destroying knowing others were celebrating new life, when a life had been taken from me. Future mothers should never experience this tragedy and is why I am calling for legislative change.
attributes.additional_details:
According to stillbirth charity 'Tommy's Organisation', one in every 225 births ends in stillbirth in the UK - making that nine babies every day. It's also estimated that 4.2 million are living with depression associated with previous stillbirth - a number which cannot go ignored.

It's imperative to change the future of these bereaved mothers by creating the best environment possible for one to give birth to a dead child, and to ensure we provide the tools to be able to cope with such a loss.

attributes.action: Force the supermarkets to provide refill station for all basic groceries.
attributes.background: Most of groceries are bought in single use plastic packaging. It should be possible for everyone to buy all his/her groceries without unnecessary packaging. Supermarkets should provide at least their own brand groceries in dispensers where customers have to bring their own containers to fill them.
attributes.additional_details:
This should include the following: rice/pasta, cereal/ flour, spices/salt, loose tea/coffee, oils, shampoo/conditioner/hand wash, washing liquid, laundry liquid/powder/fabric conditioner.
Plastics are difficult to recycle because there are so many types that have to be separated.
Plastic can be recycled 7-9 times before it is no longer recyclable.
Paper can be recycled 4-6 times. Glass, steel and aluminium lose no quality during recycling and can be recycled endlessly.
According to Defra: less that 50% of UK's waste is recycled.
According to British Plastic Federation: Overall 32% of plastic is recycled and 46% for plastic packaging.  
According to British Plastic Federation the waste hierarchy should be as follows: Prevention, Preparing for reuse, Energy recovery, Disposal.

attributes.action: Ban average speed cameras due to them being a distraction for drivers.
attributes.background: Highways England have declared that an incredibly realistic looking 'dummy' average speed camera is distracting and therefore is unsafe for the public, and have requested Bedfordshire county council have the camera removed.
attributes.additional_details:
By stating this, it stands to reason all average speed cameras are unsafe
 
Given the similarities between the dummy camera and normal average speed cameras, I believe Highways England have effectively stated all average speed cameras are distracting. 

The government rightly outlawed the use of mobile phones behind the wheel because they are distracting. It is therefore reasonable for all average speed cameras to be banned.
